name: Tirupati Balaji

location.sacred_geography: Located in the Tirumala hills (Seshachalam range)

significance.philosophy: The shrine is central to Kaliyuga bhakti traditions focused on grace, service, and darshan.
significance.scriptural_reference: Varaha Purana and regional Sthala Purana traditions

stats.daily_visitors: Varies significantly by season and festival calendar
stats.annual_visitors: Among the highest pilgrimage footfalls in India
stats.annual_revenue_crores: Varies year to year; refer to TTD reports

description: Sri Venkateswara Temple at Tirumala is one of India's most prominent pilgrimage institutions, administered by Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD). It is widely recognized for high daily footfall, structured darshan systems, and extensive religious and social-service programs.
secret_hook: The Tirumala tradition combines liturgical worship, large-scale pilgrim management, and service activities in one of India's most closely observed temple ecosystems.
